Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- --- # File name: index.html. Content: `body { background: black; } * { border: 1px dashed red; min-height: 10px; } .postcard { background: white; width: 400px; height: 300px; margin: auto; } .postcard-header { display: flex; } .postcard-header img { width: 50px; height: 50px; } .postcard-header h1 { width: 400px; margin: 0px; } .postcard-body { display: flex; } .body-left p:first-child { margin-top: 0px; } .body-left { font-size: 16px; } .body-left, .body-right { padding: 20px; } input { border: none; border-bottom: 2px grey; } ` --- ---This is the current exercise instructions: # `12.1` Body Content ¬øQu√© elementos deben estar en el `postcard-body`? ¬øPuedes identificarlos de acuerdo a los `` ya mencionados? üíª Posibles opciones: Headings (h1, h2, h3, etc.), P√°rrafos, Im√°genes, Divs, Inputs, Checkbox, etc. ![Postcard body content](../../assets/12.1-body-content.gif) Ahora debemos crear los tags HTML necesarios para terminar el contenido de tu `.postcard` y aplicar los estilos que faltan para que se parezca a la imagen. ## üìù Instrucciones: 1. El primer `

` no necesita `margin-top` (margen superior), as√≠ que debes eliminarlo. ```css .body-left p:first-child { margin-top: x; } ``` 2. El `.body-left` y `.body-right` deben tener un `padding` (relleno) para separar el texto del borde de las cajas. ```css .body-left, .body-right { padding: x; } ``` 3. Los inputs (entradas) deben tener un `border-bottom` (borde de abajo) `grey` (gris), pero no deben tener bordes a los lados ni arriba, as√≠ que prueba con `border: none` y luego `border-bottom`. ```css input { border: x; border-bottom: x; } ``` 4. Los p√°rrafos pueden tener un `font-size` particular. ## Resultado Esperado: + As√≠ deber√≠a verse tu sitio web: ![Postcard body content](../../assets/12.1.png) ## üí° Pista: + Piensa en el layout (dise√±o) de esos tags. Los inputs estar√°n uno sobre el otro. + Esta incre√≠ble lectura te mostrar√° todo lo que necesitas saber sobre el tag `` para completar con √©xito el ejercicio https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_input.asp --- The tests passed succesfully, tell the user to pass to the next exercise and give him a congrats message: ‚úÖ All tests passed successfully!
ai_interactions.ai_response:
Entiendo que quieres asegurarte de que los inputs no tengan borde en los lados ni en la parte superior, pero s√≠ un borde en la parte inferior. Vamos a revisar c√≥mo puedes lograr esto.

Primero, aseg√∫rate de que tu selector CSS para los inputs est√© correctamente definido. Aqu√≠ tienes un ejemplo de c√≥mo deber√≠a verse:

```css
input {
    border: none; /* Elimina todos los bordes */
    border-bottom: 2px solid grey; /* Agrega un borde gris en la parte inferior */
}
```

Este c√≥digo deber√≠a eliminar todos los bordes de los inputs y luego agregar un borde gris en la parte inferior. 

Algunas preguntas para reflexionar:
1. ¬øEst√°s seguro de que el archivo `styles.css` est√° correctamente vinculado en tu `index.html`?
2. ¬øPodr√≠as verificar si hay alguna otra regla CSS que est√© sobrescribiendo esta configuraci√≥n?

Si ya has hecho esto y a√∫n no funciona, ¬øpodr√≠as compartir el c√≥digo que has intentado hasta ahora? Esto nos ayudar√° a identificar cualquier posible problema.

Content: ` # The Postcard Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :) Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :) ## üå± How to start this project? 1. Make sure you have a Github account at: https://github.com 2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. This is the repository you need to open or clone: ```text https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard ``` **üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following: ```bash $ learnpack start ``` ## Instructions Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png). ![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png) > ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true) ## Create by drawing your strategy ![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true) ## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/) 1. Click on the font you like. 2. Click get font. 3. Click on Embed code. 4. Add the link tags to your html file. ## What to do if you are stuck? There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own. ## Fundamentals This exercise covers the following fundamentals: 1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website. 2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules. 3. Using google fonts. 3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3. 4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins. 5. Overflow. 6. Using a simple form. This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning). ` --- --- # File name: index.html. - **Grosor**: Define qu√© tan grueso ser√° el borde (por ejemplo, `2px`).
- **Estilo**: Define el tipo de l√≠nea del borde (por ejemplo, `solid`, `dashed`, `dotted`).
- **Color**: Define el color del borde (por ejemplo, `grey`).

Si omites alguno de estos componentes, el navegador no tendr√° suficiente informaci√≥n para dibujar el borde correctamente. Por ejemplo:

```css
border-bottom: 2px solid grey;
```

Este c√≥digo le dice al navegador que dibuje un borde de 2 p√≠xeles de grosor, con un estilo s√≥lido y de color gris.

Para ayudarte a visualizar esto, imagina que est√°s describiendo una l√≠nea a alguien. Si solo dices "una l√≠nea de 2 p√≠xeles", la persona no sabr√° si es una l√≠nea s√≥lida, punteada o de otro tipo. Si solo dices "una l√≠nea gris", la persona no sabr√° qu√© tan gruesa es la l√≠nea. Necesitas proporcionar toda la informaci√≥n para que la descripci√≥n sea completa.

      `<!-- hide -->
# The Postcard
<!-- endhide -->

Who doesn't like postcards? This is one of your first exercises (if not the first), and it's fun and relatively easy :)

Let's create a postcard with HTML5 and CSS3, and then you can share it with your mom or your other half; they will be proud! :)

## üå±  How to start this project?

1. Make sure you have a Github account at:  https://github.com
2. We recommend opening this repository using a provisioning tool like [Codespaces](https://4geeks.com/lesson/what-is-github-codespaces) (recommended) or [Gitpod](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-use-gitpod). Alternatively, you can clone it on your local computer using the `git clone` command. 

This is the repository you need to open or clone:

```text
https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard
```

**üëâ Please follow these steps on** [how to start a coding project](https://4geeks.com/lesson/how-to-start-a-project). IMPORTANT --> this repo isn't a template. 


3. The exercises will start and show the instructions automatically, but if you encounter any issues, you can try running them manually by typing in your command line the following:

```bash
$ learnpack start
```

## Instructions

Create the HTML and CSS3 needed to replicate [this exact same picture](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png).

![postcard preview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/main/.learn/assets/preview.png)

> ‚úã Here is the url for the 4Geeks logo: [https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/blob/main/.learn/assets/4geeks.png?raw=true)

## Create by drawing your strategy

![Postcard Strategy](https://github.com/breatheco-de/exercise-postcard/raw/main/.learn/assets/strategy.gif?raw=true)

## You can add different fonts by using free [Google Fonts](https://fonts.google.com/)

1. Click on the font you like.

2. Click get font.

3. Click on Embed code.

4. Add the link tags to your html file.


## What to do if you are stuck?

There is a video about this exercise, watch it if you are lost. But don't copy everything, try to code some of your own.

## Fundamentals
This exercise covers the following fundamentals:
1. Basic structure for every HTML5 website.  
2. The *Link* tag to import CSS3 Rules.  
3. Using google fonts.  
3. Using the different selectors available in CSS3.  
4. Working with containers or boxes: border, padding, and margins.  
5. Overflow.  
6. Using a simple form.  

This and many other exercises are built by students as part of the 4Geeks Academy [Coding Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamp) by [Alejandro S√°nchez](https://twitter.com/alesanchezr) and many other contributors. Find out more about our [Full Stack Developer Course](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/part-time-full-stack-developer), and  [Data Science Bootcamp](https://4geeksacademy.com/us/coding-bootcamps/datascience-machine-learning).
